summary: Feature request to review and expose timeout, retries, and reconnection configuration for the TypeScript SDK client connection, similar to the Java SDK's gRPC-level and SDK-level retry mechanisms.
userImpact: Users need better control over connection retry behavior and timeouts to handle network issues and service unavailability more robustly.
rootCause: The TypeScript SDK lacked configurable retry and timeout settings at both gRPC and SDK levels, unlike the Java SDK implementation.
proposedFix: Expose retry configuration with sensible defaults, and handle automatic deadline propagation (though grpc-js may not support this).
resolutionDetails: Implemented a configurable retryer that does not retry deadline exceeded errors by default, addressing the core requirement.
keyQuote: Closing this since the retryer exists, is configurable, and does not retry deadline exceeded errors by default which is the right thing to do.
